Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Attic, probably black-figured, pottery closed vessel, probably a trefoil oinochoe; hint of out-turn or moulding at top break; interior: glazed black above, reserved below; exterior: glazed black on neck with two added red bands; on shoulder, band of spirals with black triangles; trace of possible figure scene below (if in black-figure, diagonal line and top of curved form).
Curator's comments: For a distant parallel, see the white ground oinochoe (46.11.7) by the Painter of London B620 in the Metropolitan Museum.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0313) (Phase 1)
